content.raw:
Since this isn't on the normal user path of configuring, building, and installing the project, an error printout isn't a blocker, since we (as developers) are probably the only ones who would see it.

As a developer, I'd prefer not to see false positive errors printing out, because then I need to mentally track which errors are legitimate versus which are expected, and I'd rather not let myself get comfortable with the sight of errors and warnings.

But again, it's not necessarily a blocker.

As a developer, I'd prefer not to see false positive errors printing out, because then I need to mentally track which errors are legitimate versus which are expected, and I'd rather not let myself get comfortable with the sight of errors and warnings.

But again, it's not necessarily a blocker.
